outputs.output_descr: This activity will involve an in-depth analysis of the rural development sector and Gender. Two national consultants will be hired to carry out the assignment. the main deliverable will be  a report on the gender analysis in the rural development sector and this will act as a bench mark for the review of the draft IRDS and formulation of a new gender responsive IRDS.

As an implementing partner, MoLGRD is expected to take a leading role in driving programmatic processes. They must be in a position to articulate both the conceptual and underpinnings of IRD as well as their practical implications withing decentralized governance. The MoLGRD staff will have to demonstrate leadership in the conception, planning, coordination, implementing and monitoring Local governance and IRD processes at all levels hence the need for capacity development of the key technical personnel.

The results of the evaluation of the NDP I and II will act as a benchmark for the formulation of the medium term programme on local governance and IRD.  A national consultant will work closely with an expert from the regional service center during the formulation process.

project_descr: The project aims to develop and clarify the policy and institutional framework for planning, coordinating, implementing and monitoring IRD which would in turn facilitate the realization of the overarching goal of IRD in the MGDS II
